topic: Item Analysis 101: Difficulty, Discrimination and Distractor Efficiency

refs.content: Introduces item difficulty (p‑value) and discrimination (point‑biserial) with classroom‑level interpretation and thresholds.
Worked examples of distractor analysis—how non‑functioning distractors lower discrimination and how to revise them.
Technical note on computing/reading point‑biserial correlations and caveats for small cohorts.

special_instructions: Include formulas and a step‑by‑step example dataset (10 items × 30 students) with computed stats and decision rules for revision.
